entry.content:

entry.title: Newsletter #81
entry.content:
It’s #TechThursday again!

It’s true that we are nerds but it’s also true that we are working for a fashion company.

This is one of our attempts to get more fashionable:

Here is the traditional “selection” of links our team found interesting this week , enjoy:

  • Using the HTML5 History API

  • What UX Can Learn from Print

  • Linux insides ebook

  • V8 – Experimental new directions for Javascript

  • Booboo: error handler for PHP

  • Debugging with PhpStorm

  • RedPen: an awesome visual feedback tool

  • 9 truths that computer programmers know that most people don’t

  • Google CFO retires with a candid memo about work/life balance

  • Numbers everyone should know

  • How many package managers should I support?

  • Multi-host docker network

  • Why this tech bubble is worse than the one in 2000

  • How can I simulate a slow machine in a VM?

  • Introducing Google Cloud Storage Nearline: (near)online data at an offline price

that’s all folks, see you next week! :)

entry.title: Newsletter #73
entry.content:
Hello folks! Here you go with your weekly dose of #techthursday, we have some team updates for this week! Yeahh! the Business Intelligence (BI) team has also sent us some links for the newsletter.

Thanks to Lucio for a new nginx docker image that applies the google page speed goodies.

Woo hoo, we would like to welcome the new joiners Disu and Filippo to our team.

Aaaand!! we moved to a new office.
